title: Mac version of Edge
body: Produce a Mac version of Edge so developers on Mac can see how their work effects Edge users. This would also improve the user experience for people running Edge on Windows.

comments.body: This is very likely never going to happen but one thing that Mac developers should be aware of is services like BrowserStack: https://www.browserstack.com/ - I use this to troubleshoot IE/Edge issues all the time.

Oh yes and how about a windows version of safari while you're at it. I don't think this will ever happen as Steven commented, "Edge is tied into the OS". If you want to test in Edge on a Mac, use a virtual machine, either locally or use a service like crossbrowsertesting.com.
I'd really like this as well. It'd be great to have this when developing on a Mac; I'd switch away from Chrome in a heartbeat.
If there was a native version of Edge for MacOS, I would probably switch from Chrome. I have a mix of MacOS, iOS and Windows devices and having Favorites synchronized on all devices is a top concern.

If you'd like to test in Microsoft Edge from your Mac, you can do that for free with remote testing in your browser with BrowserStack (https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/remote/), or you can install a free VM (https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/vms/).
